ygData.msgSnippet: ... It s more cost effective to work your skill to 135 and then start making cloaks. At skill lvl 145, you ll be making them with about a 30% success (or so
ygData.messageBody:
>From: bonecrkr@...
>
>I am a new smith on the Erollisi Marr server. I have gotten my skill up to
>112 but have only made one piece of banded armor so far. I figure skewers
>are good for another 3 points and then I could move onto pots and sewing
>kits if needed. My question is at what point can a smith make banded
>cloaks with a reasonable degree of success? Should I quit trying to raise
>my skill and graduate to only making armor or should I blow the rest of my
>platinum on pots and sewing kits? Anyone have any experience with trying
>to make the cloaks with only 112-115 skill level? Does it become much more
>cost effective (ie does it greatly increase you success rate) to move from
>115 (skewers) to 122 (pots) and then 135 (sewing kits). The only reference
>I have for this is a guide to blacksmithing that says my skill needs to be
>145 to make cloaks. I see no way to bring it to that level except by
>making armor.
>

It's more cost effective to work your skill to 135 and then start making
cloaks. At skill lvl 145, you'll be making them with about a 30% success (or
so I'm led to believe; could be wrong though).
